Following his goal against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on his [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] debut, he has scored in all of the top four divisions of English league football, scoring for [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] in [[EFL League Two|League Two]], [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] and [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in [[EFL League One|League One]], [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] in the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] and Blackpool, Southampton and Crystal Palace in the Premier League. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Croydon]], Greater London, Puncheon began his career with [[Wimbledon F.C.|Wimbledon]], and moved [[Relocation of Wimbledon F.C. to Milton Keynes|with the team]] to Milton Keynes, where the club became [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in 2004. He was released in January 2006. He moved to [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] in June of the same year, after brief spells with [[Fisher Athletic F.C.|Fisher Athletic]] and [[Lewes F.C.|Lewes]].{{cite book |last=Hugman |first=Barry |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2007–08 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |year=2007 |isbn=978-1-84596-246-3 |page=332}} He was named [[FA Cup]] Player of the Third Round in 2007 and the following season after scoring a succession of brilliant goals (including a last minute 35-yard free kick versus Bradford) was named in the PFA Team of the Season.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/fa_cup/6271595.stm |title=Puncheon nets FA Cup player award |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2007 |accessdate=5 January 2010}} ===Plymouth Argyle=== [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] signed Puncheon from Barnet for £250,000 in 2008. He endured an unsuccessful 18-month spell at the club, making six league appearances. He was loaned to former club MK Dons three times in two years, where he scored 11 goals in 51 appearances. ===Southampton=== On 30 January 2010, Puncheon joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] which then led to his loan deal at MK Dons to be cut short.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~1949524,00.html |title=Puncheon joins Saints |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=30 January 2010 |accessdate=30 January 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100201051858/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10280~1949524%2C00.html |archivedate=1 February 2010 |df=dmy-all}} He scored his first goal in a 5–1 victory over Walsall, and scored again a few days later, in a 5–0 victory over Huddersfield. At the start of the 2010–11 season, he was a regular in the first team. However, when [[Alan Pardew]] lost his job just days after a 4–0 win away to [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]], Southampton hired [[Nigel Adkins]] as manager. Under Adkins, he stayed in the first team, but found himself under increasing pressure from [[Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain]] for his place. Eventually Adkins lost patience with Puncheon's erratic performances, and dropped him to the bench in favour of 17-year-old Chamberlain, who was later sold to Arsenal for a reported £15m. On 16 November 2010, Puncheon moved on an emergency loan deal to [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]].{{cite web |title=Jason To Join Lions |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~2222518,00.html |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=17 November 2010 |date=16 November 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101119000200/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10280~2222518%2C00.html |archivedate=19 November 2010 |df=}} He scored his first goal on his first game for Millwall in their 1–0 victory over [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].{{cite news |title=Middlesbrough 0–1 Millwall |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/9194875.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=5 December 2010 |date=20 November 2010}} On 1 January 2011, Puncheon scored a [[hat-trick]] in the 3–0 victory over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].{{cite news |title=Millwall 3–0 Crystal Palace |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/9322923.stm |accessdate=1 January 2011 |date=1 January 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport}} On 31 January 2011, Puncheon joined [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite news |title=Holloway pounces for Puncheon |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12875_6715303,00.html |accessdate=31 January 2011 |date=31 January 2011 |publisher=Sky Sports}} He made his debut, scoring a goal, at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on 5 February.{{cite news |last=Phillips |first=Owen |title=Everton 5–3 Blackpool |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9384152.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=6 February 2011 |date=5 February 2011}} He scored his second goal against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 7 March at [[Bloomfield Road]]. Puncheon re-joined the Saints after Blackpool's failed attempt to fight off relegation.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/9043848.Relegated_Puncheon_back_with_Saints/ |title=Relegated Puncheon back with Saints |newspaper=Daily Echo |date=24 May 2011 |accessdate=24 May 2011}} On 31 August 2011, Puncheon joined [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on loan until 2 January 2012.{{cite web |title=Punch Off |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~2438739,00.html |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=1 September 2011 |date=1 September 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120919222655/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10280~2438739%2C00.html |archivedate=19 September 2012 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news |title=QPR sign Southampton forward Jason Puncheon on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14752434.stm |accessdate=10 September 2011 |date=1 September 2011}} He returned to the Saints after his unsuccessful loan spell at QPR,{{cite news |first=Nabil |last=Hassan |title=Southampton do not want to keep Jason Puncheon, says agent |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16490298 |newspaper=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 February 2012 |date=10 January 2012}} but on 21 January 2012, he publicly criticised Executive chairman [[Nicola Cortese]].{{cite news |title=Jason Puncheon criticises Southampton chairman Nicola Cortese |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16678939.stm |newspaper=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 January 2012 |date=23 January 2011}} However just days later, it was revealed that Puncheon had apologised to Cortese and would be available for selection in the first team.{{cite news |title=Jason Puncheon settles Twitter row with Southampton. chairman |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16726108.stm |newspaper=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 February 2012 |date=25 January 2012}} He then started the next two matches: a 1–1 draw in the [[FA Cup]] at [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]]{{cite web |title=Millwall vs Southampton |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10280~61469,00.html |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=3 February 2012 |date=28 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120131184229/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10280~61469%2C00.html |archivedate=31 January 2012 |df=dmy-all}} and a 1–1 draw in the Championship against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].{{cite web |title=Southampton vs Cardiff City |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10280~59503,00.html |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=3 February 2012 |date=31 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120202031405/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10280~59503%2C00.html |archivedate=2 February 2012 |df=dmy-all}} He scored his first goal of the 2012–13 season with a 30-yard volley in a league cup win at [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]]. He scored his first Premier League goal for Southampton in a 4–1 home victory against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. His second came when Southampton won 3–1 away to Queens Park Rangers. He scored his third Premier League goal in the 61st minute against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] to secure Southampton a vital 1–0 victory and move them out of the relegation zone. His fourth was scored to give [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] a 2–2 draw away to the Champions of Europe [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. On 9 February 2013, he scored his fifth in [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton's]] 3–1 home win against 2011–12 champions [[Manchester City]]. On 1 March 2013, Puncheon signed a new contract with Southampton, expiring in 2016.{{cite news |title=Jason Puncheon signs new contract at Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21637252 |newspaper=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 March 2013 |date=1 March 2013}} ===Crystal Palace=== On 21 August 2013, Puncheon signed a one-year loan with [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].{{cite news |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2013/august/palace-sign-puncheon-on-loan/ |title=Palace sign Puncheon on loan |date=21 August 2013 |accessdate=21 August 2013 |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C.}} He missed a penalty as Palace lost 2–0 away to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 11 January 2014,{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25600519 |title=Tottenham 2–0 Crystal Palace |first=Timothy |last=Abraham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 January 2014 |accessdate=17 May 2014}} but made up for his miss by scoring the only goal of their 1–0 win against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] the following weekend.{{cite news |last=Chase |first=Graham |title=Crystal Palace 1–0 Stoke |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25693671 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 May 2014 |date=18 January 2014}} On 31 January 2014, Puncheon made his loan spell into a permanent move, for a fee of around £1.75m.{{Cite web |title=Puncheon pens permanent deal |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2014/january/puncheon-pens-permanent-deal/ |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |date=31 January 2014}} Puncheon's three goals in January and a further three in back-to-back wins in April that lifted Palace away from the relegation zone, led boss Tony Pulis to issue a 'hands off' warning to other clubs interesting in signing Puncheon.{{cite news |title=Jason Puncheon is not going anywhere warns Crystal Palace boss Pulis |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/jason-puncheon-is-not-going-anywhere-warns-crystal-palace-boss-pulis-9250768.html |newspaper=London Evening Standard |accessdate=14 April 2014 |date=10 April 2014}} On 16 August 2014, in Palace's first match of the new season away to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], Puncheon took a corner which was headed in by [[Brede Hangeland]] for the first goal of the game. He was sent off for his second booking in the 89th minute, after which Arsenal scored their winning goal.{{cite news |last1=Chowdhury |first1=Saj |title=Arsenal 2–1 Crystal Palace |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28718788 |accessdate=16 August 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2014}} On 17 January 2015, Puncheon scored his third goal of the season and second in as many games against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in a 3–2 away win. Crystal Palace had come from 2 goals down to claim victory to boost their survival hopes. Palace manager [[Alan Pardew]] heaped praise on Puncheon's performance, describing him as "the best player on the pitch by a country mile."{{cite news |last1=McMath |first1=James |title=Burnley 2–3 Crystal Palace |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30758390 |accessdate=18 January 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2015}} On 6 April 2015, Puncheon scored the winning goal for Crystal Palace against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. Puncheon's goal came from a freekick which went past Manchester City's goalkeeper [[Joe Hart]].{{Cite news |url=https://lockerdome.com/6556955711900993/7565437722568724 |title=Jason Puncheon free kick helps Crystal Palace defeat Man City |date=6 April 2015 |website=LockerDome|access-date=3 April 2017 |language=en-US}} He opened the scoring in the [[2016 FA Cup Final]] against Manchester United with a goal in the 78th minute, but Palace went on to lose the match 2–1 after extra time.{{cite news |last1=Taylor |first1=Daniel |title=Manchester United win FA Cup as Jesse Lingard sinks Crystal Palace |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/21/crystal-palace-manchester-united-fa-cup-final-match-report |accessdate=4 February 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=21 May 2016}} On 18 July 2017, Puncheon replaced [[Scott Dann]] as captain.{{cite web |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2017/july/puncheon-confirmed-as-palace-captain/ |title=Puncheon confirmed as Palace captain |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |date=18 July 2017 |accessdate=21 November 2017}} In January 2018, manager [[Roy Hodgson]] announced that Puncheon would play no further part in the [[2017–18 Crystal Palace F.C. season|2017–18 season]] following a [[cruciate ligament]] injury sustained while playing against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite news |title=Scott Dann and Jason Puncheon: Crystal Palace duo out for rest of season |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 January 2018 |accessdate=3 January 2018 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42548138}} ===Huddersfield Town=== On 4 January 2019, Puncheon signed for Premier League club [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46764967 |title=Jason Puncheon: Huddersfield sign Crystal Palace winger on loan for rest of season |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 January 2019 |accessdate=4 January 2019}} ==Personal life== Puncheon is of Jamaican descent and is eligible for the [[Jamaica national football team]].{{cite news |last1=Collomosse |first1=Tom |title=Jamaica hoping to poach Liverpool's Andre Wisdom, Tottenham's Danny Rose and Crystal Palace's Jason Puncheon for Copa America |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/jamaica-hoping-to-poach-liverpools-andre-wisdom-tottenhams-danny-rose-and-crystal-palaces-jason-10097836.html |accessdate=19 December 2017 |newspaper=The Independent |date=10 March 2015}} In December 2017, Puncheon was arrested and charged with possession of an offensive weapon, common assault, and a public order offence of "causing fear or provocation of violence" after a fight outside a nightclub in [[Reigate]].{{cite news |last1=Aarons |first1=Ed |title=Crystal Palace's Jason Puncheon charged with assault and possession of weapon |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/dec/18/jason-puncheon-crystal-palace-assault-arrested |accessdate=19 December 2017 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=18 December 2017}}{{cite news |title=Crystal Palace's Jason Puncheon on weapon charge |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-surrey-42392660 |publisher=BBC News |accessdate=19 December 2017 |date=18 December 2017}} On 5 January 2018, Puncheon appeared in court where he denied the charge of assault. The charge of possessing an offensive weapon was withdrawn and he was bailed to appear again in court on 4 June.{{cite news |title=Crystal Palace footballer Jason Puncheon denies assault |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-surrey-42579835 |accessdate=5 January 2018 |publisher=BBC News |date=4 February 2018}} He later changed his plea to guilty and was given a community order requiring him to carry out 210 hours of unpaid work, and pay the doorman involved £250 compensation.{{cite news |title=Crystal Palace's Jason Puncheon admits bouncer belt attack
